content: Excellent news, Rohan. Your CAC score is 0. This is the best possible result - no detectable calcified plaque in your coronary arteries. It's a strong reassurance that our preventative strategy is working exactly as intended.
That's a huge relief, Warren. Gives me confidence the effort is worth it.
Morning Rohan. I'll document the CAC outcome in your health timeline and update your dashboard. Congratulations - this is a big win. Shall I also share a summary with Sarah for your medical file?
Yes please, Ruby. Good to have it on record.

Rohan, I just wanted to acknowledge this milestone. A CAC of 0 at 46 is powerful. It validates the strategy we've built together. You've embraced the role of co-researcher in your own health, and it's showing clearly in the data.
Appreciate you saying that, Neel. Definitely feels like we're steering things rather than reacting.
Quick reminder, Rohan - the cook is testing two new low-GI breakfast options this week. I'll send you feedback forms after day 3 so we can choose which one to keep long-term.
Sounds good. Will let you know how they sit before morning calls.

Evening, Rohan, here's a fascinating trend from last 4 weeks. On days where glycemic variability was high, your deep sleep that night dropped by an avg of 22 mins. This is the flywheel effect: Carla's nutrition plan isn't only metabolic; it's critical for recovery too.
Very interesting. Does this flywheel extend to cognition as well? If I stabilize glucose, am I giving the brain steadier energy, helping the focus I've been tracking with piano practice?

Exactly. There's growing evidence that stable glucose correlates with more consistent cognitive performance. Early signal in your focus scores supports this. We'll keep tracking to strengthen the hypothesis

Rohan, just to connect the dots, when you keep post-meal glucose steady, you're not only protecting your heart and sleep, you're literally fueling your brain in a more even way. Food becomes a tool for sharper cognition.
That framing helps, Carla. Makes it easier to stick with it when I see the link beyond just cholesterol numbers.
I've coordinated with Sarah - the mobile phlebotomist is confirmed for Tuesday 25th at 8am for your Q2 diagnostics. Please remember 12h fasting. I'll send you and Sarah a reminder the day before.
Thanks Ruby, noted. Tuesday works.

Quick note: the mobility drills you've been doing pre-calls are paying off. Your Garmin load shows less HR fluctuation during presentations. Let's progress next week into a slightly longer dynamic warmup.
Great! Honestly those 5 mins before Zooms help me feel sharper. Let's push it a bit more.
Morning Rohan, just checking, did the new breakfast variation (chia-yogurt blend) work for you? The cook asked for feedback.
Texture was fine, less heavy than oats. Can keep this one.
As we approach your Q2 blood panel, the key is maintaining consistency this week. That way the results reflect your actual progress. No sudden changes - steady state gives us clean, reliable data.
Understood. Will stay the course until the draw.
Morning reminder. Hydration target is 2.5L today (humid weather flagged in forecast). I'll have the cook add infused water pitchers at your desk setup.
Perfect, thanks Ruby.

Just stepping in briefly, Rohan, closing in on Q2, your adherence sits right on the 50% we modelled, but the *quality* of execution is high. That's why outcomes like CAC=0 are possible. Keep your eye on consistency this week.
Good perspective, Neel. Will focus on not overcomplicating this final stretch.
Noticed you skipped lunch today, watch for rebound snacking later. I'll suggest a quick high-protein option to keep glucose steady if that happens.
Yeah, back-to-back calls killed lunch. Will take your backup snack tomorrow if same thing repeats.
Friendly nudge - morning HRV dipped slightly today. Nothing concerning, but maybe swap your run for mobility + light cardio? Rachel agrees.
Alright, will dial it back. Thanks for catching it.
Good call adjusting this morning. Micro-recoveries like today will keep the flywheel spinning without breakdown. Trust the rhythm üëç
Makes sense. Actually felt fresher heading into calls.
Latest data set uploaded - flywheel trend still strong: lower glycemic swings ‚Üí more deep sleep ‚Üí better recovery scores. This triad is becoming the cornerstone of your health system.
Clear to see now. Small levers compounding into bigger wins.
Hi Rohan, just a heads-up - the phlebotomist will arrive Tue 25th, 8am sharp. Fasting from 8pm the night before. I'll check in Mon evening to confirm logistics.
Noted. Appreciate you staying on top of this, Ruby.
One last nutrition tweak for the week: try moving your fruit portion into the first half of the day. Better glucose stability in evenings ‚Üí smoother sleep onset.
Got it. Will test tomorrow.

Closing note for the week - Rohan, the team's aligned and you're in a great place heading into diagnostics. This week showed the flywheel effect in action. You've turned this into a genuine partnership with your own health.
Thanks Neel. Feels like momentum's building in the right way.
Perfect wrap to the week. I'll consolidate notes for your Monday dashboard. Enjoy the weekend with the family, Rohan.
